humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the largest tumor size is 3.7 cm in greatest diameter, which falls under the T2 category of being more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma, so the T stage is still T2. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma, so the T stage is still T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has a unifocal, well differentiated infiltrating ductal carcinoma with a mucinous component that measures 3.7 cm in greatest diameter in the left breast (specimen H). The tumor is located within 1 cm from the lateral margin, 1.2 cm from the anterior margin, 2.2 cm from the medial margin, 1.7 cm from the deep margin, and 1.7 cm from the inferior margin. Therefore, the T stage is T2 (tumor size ≥ 3 cm and ≤ 5 cm).
